column4: Amgen psoriatic arthritis drug maintains efficacy after 1 yr -study

column5: BRUSSELS Apple said on Wednesday that it has not received any selective tax treatment from the Irish authorities after European Union state aid regulators opened an investigation into the issue.

column5: DUBLIN Ireland is confident that it has not breached state aid rules in its tax dealings with Apple and will defend its position vigorously  the department of finance said in a statement on Wednesday.

column4: Time Warner Cable's former CEO  Britt  dies at 65

column4: Indonesia's motorbike sales rise faster in May
column5: JAKARTA  June 11 Indonesia's annual motorbike sales rose at a faster pace in May than the previous month  industry data showed on Wednesday  reflecting stronger domestic demand.     Sales in May were up 14.7 percent from a year earlier  compared with 10.5 percent in April.     There were 739 511 motorbikes sold in Southeast Asia's biggest economy  rising marginally on a monthly basis  according to the Indonesian Motorbike Industry Association (AISI). column4: Indian shares snap 4-day rally on profit-taking; Infosys gains
column5: MUMBAI  June 11 Indian shares snapped a four-day winning streak after hitting all-time highs for the fourth session on Wednesday as investors booked profits in recent outperformers such as infrastructure and capital goods stocks.

column4: IBM close to selling chip-making unit to Globalfoundries-Bloomberg
column5: June 10 IBM Corp is nearing a deal to sell its chip-making business to contract chipmaker Globalfoundries Inc  Bloomberg reported  citing people familiar with the matter.

column5: -- Note: Reuters has not verified this story and does not vouch for its accuracy

column4: Exclusive: U.S. using JPMorgan penalty to speed cases against other banks
column5: WASHINGTON/NEW YORK The U.S. Justice Department is spending some of the $13 billion JPMorgan Chase & Co agreed to pay to settle claims stemming from mortgage misdeeds to speed up similar punishments against other lenders  possibly including Bank of America Corp and Citigroup  according to people familiar with the matter.

column4: With concentrated bets  tiny U.S. mutual funds jump up rankings
column5: NEW YORK For U.S. mutual fund investors  this is shaping up to be a year when it pays to go small.

column4: KB Fin preferred bidder for LIG Insurance stake after $590 mln bid -source
column5: SEOUL  June 11 South Korea's KB Financial Group Inc has been chosen as the preferred bidder to buy 20 percent of LIG Insurance after submitting an offer of about 600 billion won ($590 million)  a source working on the deal said.

column4: Australia and Japan agree to pursue closer military technology ties
column5: TOKYO  June 11 Australia and Japan on Wednesday said they would create a framework pact to cooperate on military technology  a move that could pave the way for Japan to supply stealth submarine designs and components to Australia.

column4: MasterCard expects big growth from 'big data' insights
column5: BERLIN MasterCard Inc  the world's second-largest debit and credit card company  sees business booming from selling data to retailers  banks and governments on spending patterns found in the payments it processes  a top executive told Reuters.

column4: China shares tepid after MSCI keeps mainland stocks out of benchmark index
column5: HONG KONG  June 11 China shares ended flat on Wednesday after equity index provider MSCI decided not to add A-shares to its benchmark emerging markets index  which dented hopes of hefty capital inflows for mainland markets.

column4: Nikkei rises as MSCI review supports sentiment  eyes on BOJ meeting
column5: TOKYO  June 11 Japanese shares bounced off a one-week low on Wednesday supported by news that Japan will retain its status as the only developed market in the region in MSCI stock indexes  checking  any potential knee-jerk rotation out of Tokyo equities.     MSCI announced that it was removing South Korea and Taiwan from its review list for reclassification to developed markets.       The Nikkei gained 0.5 percent to 15 069.48. column4: Pfizer says Astra quest failed due to price
column5: Pfizer Inc's chief financial officer on Wednesday said his company failed in its attempted $118 billion takeover of AstraZeneca Plc because they could not agree on the value of the British drugmaker.

column4: PHILIPPINES PRESS-PLDT expects Q2 profit to be 'better than last year' - BusinessWorld
column5: Philippine Long Distance Telephone Co  the country's biggest firm by market capitalisation  expects its second-quarter profit to be "somewhat similar with last quarter's net income" and "better than last year " the BusinessWorld newspaper quoted company Chairman Manuel Pangilinan as saying.

From June 16  items that were previously published only as a compilation will be published as standalone items featuring the BUZZ tag. They will also be accessible via the STXBZ news code. A collated version will continue to appear on the WATCH/US named-item code under the headline "BUZZ-U.S. stocks on the move".

column4: Former TheStreet editor settles SEC insider trading case
column5: June 10 A former senior editor at TheStreet Inc  has agreed to pay $10 225 to resolve claims he participated in an insider trading ring involving a group of high school friends  the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said Tuesday.

column5: MILAN Insurer Generali   one of four key owners of Telecom Italia   decided on Wednesday to exit ahead of time a seven-year shareholder agreement to control the Italian phone company  making room for future new investors.

column4: UPDATE 1-Generali starts unraveling Telecom Italia ownership pact

column4: Generali agrees to quit shareholder pact in Telecom Italia's top investor
column5: MILAN  June 11 Insurer Generali kicked off the dismantling of a shareholder agreement in Telecom Italia's top investor Telco by exercising an option to leave the pact early.

column4: Amazon stops pre-orders for "Lego"  upcoming Warner videos - NYT
column5: June 10 Amazon.com Inc has refused to take pre-orders for upcoming Time Warner home video movie titles  including 'The Lego Movie'  '300: Rise of an Empire'  'Winter's Tale' and 'Transcendence'  the New York Times reported on Tuesday.

column4: Faulty Takata air bags prompt expanded Toyota recall
column5: TOKYO/DETROIT Takata Corp's  safety crisis deepened on Wednesday after Toyota Motor Corp  recalled almost 2.3 million vehicles globally  many for the second time  and the Japanese air bag maker warned that further fixes may be needed.

column4: Truck driver in Tracy Morgan 'drowsy driving' crash due in court
column5: NEW YORK A Georgia truck driver accused of causing a fatal car crash on a New Jersey highway that critically injured comedian Tracy Morgan was due in court on Wednesday to face charges of vehicular homicide while driving with too little sleep.
